By Carol Roach

Beware of salads that are worse than eating burgers at fast food restaurants. Many women get fooled by the fast food restaurants that sell salads as part of their healthy choice menus. One would think that salads would be healthier. However, it depends largely on the ingredients.
Though vegetables and fruits, as we know, are very healthy, not all salads are good for our waistlines. The biggest culprits or those containing a lot of oils, sauces, and rich salad dressings. Another hidden ingredient is the salt. According to The Telegraph in the UK, 1 out of 10 salads sold there are worst than eating a Big Mac, and it all has to do with the sodium content. Are American restaurants any better at controlling the sodium content in their salads? Though the trend now is lowering sodium content, not all restaurants have complied. It would be wise to read the web site nutritional value for fast food restaurants before visiting the restaurant. Though fast food restaurants are cheaper than other restaurants and very conveniently located in shopping malls, around industrial parks, office buildings, and main city arteries, they are not necessarily good for our health. America's obesity rate is reaching epidemic proportions.
To keep your waistline trim and your heart in good shape, consider avoiding these six salads that are worse than eating a Whopper.
Though delicious with all the croutons, creamy Caesar dressing has large portions of cheese, which can raise the caloric intake to 750 calories with about 50 grams of fat. Burger King's Chicken Caesar salad has a 27 grams of fat, 7 grams of saturated fat, 70 mg of cholesterol, and a whopping 1850 mg of sodium. This creamy delight ranks among the six salads that are worst than eating a BK burger
MedicineNet warns that MacDonald's crispy bacon ranch salads that are worse than eating a Big Mac. The salad has 51 grams of fat , 11 grams of saturated fat, 85 mg of cholesterol and 1570 mg of sodium.
Wendy's Chicken BLT Salad with homestyle garlic croutons and honey mustard dressing has 47.5 grams of fat, 12.5 grams of saturated fat, 85 mg of cholesterol, and 1630 mg of sodium.
Taco Bell's Taco Salad with Salsa has 51 grams of fat, 14 grams of saturated fat, 60 (mg )of cholesterol and 1630 mg of sodium. If you skip the salsa the sodium is reduced to 1500 mg of sodium.
One would think that a chef salad should be healthy enough, but not so for the Au Bon Pain's chef salad. It is loaded with bacon, ham, turkey, and cheese. It has 15 grams of fat, 7 grams of saturated fat, 65 mg of cholesterol, and 1370 mg of sodium
When we look at the small list of six salads that are unhealthy, we cannot just target fast food restaurants. Applebee's Grilled Shrimp 'N Spinach salad is a sneaky one. Because of the spinach, one would think this salad is a healthy choice; however, the salad contains 1,050 calories, 72 g fat (11 g saturated), and 2,530 mg sodium. Last Updated:
